item.title: Josh add a quote by V.S. Naipaul
item.description: "It is wrong to have an ideal view of the world. That's where the mischief starts. That's where everything starts unravelling..." -- V.S. Naipaul

item.title: Josh add a quote by Sinclair Lewis
item.description: "It is impossible to discourage the real writers - they don't give a damn what you say, they're going to write." -- Sinclair Lewis

item.title: Josh add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "Boredom is an instrument of social control. Power is the power to impose boredom, to command stasis, to combine this stasis with anguish. The real tedium, deep tedium, is seasoned with terror and with death." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Josh add a quote by Robert Baer
item.description: "On one level, Americans are too distant from the Middle East, too naive to understand its complexities and history. On another, it's the people who show up in Washington-Iranian and Arab exiles nursing a grudge, with time on their hands and money to pay for a hotel-who influence U.S. policy by default. They color Washington's view of the world, drawing us into foreign adventures we have no business being in." -- Robert Baer

item.title: Josh add a quote by John Updike
item.description: "You are still you. The U.S. is still the U.S., held together by credit cards and Indian names" -- John Updike

item.title: Josh add a quote by Wilfred Owen
item.description: "The old Lie:Dulce et decorum est Pro patria mori." -- Wilfred Owen

item.title: Josh add a quote by John Cheever
item.description: "Oh, what can you do with a man like that? What can you do? How can you dissuade his eye in a crowd from seeking out the cheek with acne, the infirm hand; how can you teach him to respond to the inestimable greatness of the race, the harsh surface beauty of life; how can you put his finger for him on the obdurate truths before which fear and horror are powerless? The sea that morning was iridescent and dark. My wife and my sister were swimming--Diana and Helen--and I saw their uncovered heads, black and gold in the dark water. I saw them come out and I saw that they were naked, unshy, beautiful, and full of grace, and I watched the naked women walk out of the sea." -- John Cheever

item.title: Josh add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "And I asked myself about the present: how wide it was, how deep it was, how much was mine to keep." -- Kurt Vonnegut
